did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The Reverend James Edward Coley began, in 1884, to collect and write the reminiscences of older Westport residences. In 1911-12, he rewrote and added to the information. He compiled this material in book form, but it was never printed. The original manuscript was give to the Connecticut State Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The book is organized into three chapters.
Chapter I- Old Saugatuck. Local Native Americans names. Boundaries. Incorporation of the town. First meeting and election of officers. pp.4-25

Chapter II-Early Connecticut laws respecting religion. Early Westport churches pp.26-107/schools pp.108-117. Transportation: roads and bridges pp.118-129. Stage schedule and stops, water travel and town sloops. Produce and people. Old store. Wharf. Mills. Industries and trade 1786-1830 pp.153-160. Saugatuck Manufacturing Co. 1814 Richmondville Manufacturing Co.1814. Tannery. Stores Shipping. Farm produce(onions etc.)-prices-variety of goods. "Saugatuck Journal ads 1829 pp.161-164, Schnooner " Three Brothers, Moulton Store pp 165-167.
Chapter III-Genealogical notes and reminiscences about some old families and their homes narrated to the author by "persons of the past generation" many years ago. pp.170-700
